intro: Ruschia spinosa, commonly known as the spiked Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to red, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruschia spinosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
